refnamediv.refpurpose: NFNetlink Userspace Receipt Suite Daemon, is a unstable re-implementaion of ulogd2.

refsect1.title: Options
refsect1.para: For a full summary of options, run nursd --help.

listitem.para: Print a help message about the commandline options.
Print version information about ulogd.
For off into daemon mode. Unless you are debugging, you will want to use this most of the time.
Display informations about the plugin whom filename is given as argument.
specify log filename. name ``syslog'' is reserved for syslog. default is stderr.
specify log level. select in either debug, info, notice, error and fata. info is default.
flush each log output.
config filename.

refsect1.title: description
refsect1.para: nursd consists of a core and a number of plugins. All the real power lies in the plugins, and in the user who configures the interactions between those plugins.

By means of the configuration file, the administrator can build any number of Plugin Stacks. A plugin stack is a series of plugins, starting with an producer plugin, none, one or multiple filter plugins, and one consumer or coveter plugin on top.
It is important to understand that nursd without plugins does nothing. It will receive packets, and do nothing with them.

There are three kinds of plugins, producer, filter and consumer. producer yields information from outside of nursd, typically netlink socket, filter plugins reads from it and create additional information, then consumer plugins write the interpreted information to some logfile/database/...

You can get information about plugins by running
nursd -i path/to/plugin/file.so

refsect2.title: Producer Plugins
refsect2.para: Producer plugins acts data source. They get data from somewhere outside of nursd, and convert it into a input for succeeding plugins.

refsect2.title: Filter Plugins
refsect2.para: Filter plugins interpret and/or filter data that was received from the Producer or Filter Plugin and create a input for succeeding plugins.

refsect2.title: Consumer / Coveter Plugins
refsect2.para: This plugins describe how and where to put the information gained by the Producer Plugin and processed by one or more Filter Plugins. The easiest way is to build a line per packet and fprint it to a file.

refsect1.title: configfile syntax reference
refsect1.para: nursd is what this is all about, so let's describe it's configuration... All configurable parameters of nursd are in the configfile. The following configuration parameters are available:

listitem.para: This option is followed by a filename of a ulogd plugin, which ulogd should load upon initialization. This option may appear more than once.
This option is followed by a comma separated names which consists of plugin instance id and plugin name connected by :.
This option specifys the number of thread which executes subsequent to Producer plugin.
This option specifys the number of input/output chunk of memory. This memory chunks holds per Producer.

refsect2.title: Signals
refsect2.para: nursd self understands two kinds of signals. These and others --- SIGALRM, SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 --- are delivered to each plugins by signal callback.

listitem.para: Close and re-open logfile. This is mainly intended for logrotate scripts.
Terminate nursd.

refsect2.title: nurs_producer_NFLOG.so (NFLOG)
refsect2.para: This interfaces the new nfnetlink_log interface. To compile, you need libnetfilter_log installed in your system.

listitem.para: The number of the netlink multicast group to which NFLOG'ed packets are sent. You will have to use the same group number in the NFLOG target (-\-nflog-group) and in the input plugin.

You can use this label to store information relative to the logging. The administrator can define a convention which can be used later to differenciate packet. For example, it can store the severity of the logged event.
linux/Documentation/netlink_mmap.txt
must be a multiple of the architectures memory page size. The getpagesize() function can be used to get the page size.
mmaped netlink socket frames are grouped into blocks, where each block is a continuous region of memory and holds block_size / frame_size frames. The total number of frames in the ring is frame_nr.
number of blocks to allocate.
group is 0 and this bind config is true, then invoke NFULNL_CFG_CMD_PF_BIND config command to bind AF_INET, AF_INET6 and AF_BRIDGE.
forcing unbind of existing log handler for protocol or not.
set NFULNL_CFG_F_SEQ config flag.
set NFULNL_CFG_F_SEQ_GLOBAL flag.
invoke NFULA_CFG_QTHRESH config command.
invoke NFULA_CFG_TIMEOUT config command.
specify either "packet" - NFULNL_COPY_PACKET, "meta" - NFULNL_COPY_META or "none" - NFULNL_COPY_NONE to emit config mode. "packet" is default.
copy size for "packet" mode. default is 0xffff - NLA_HDRLEN.
set NFULNL_CFG_F_CONNTRACK flag.
https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/24919/
Reliability comes at the cost of dropping new flows if the destroy event that nfnetlink delivers to us is lost. Under heavy stress this may imply dropping packets, you've been warned.
If you do want not to lose one single flow-logging information, enable this.
spacify target namespace, need to already exist.

refsect2.title: nursd_producer_NFCT.so (NFCT)
refsect2.para: This interfaces the nfnetlink_conntrack kernel subsystem, and provides flow-based logging. To compile, you need libnetfilter_conntrack installed on your system.

listitem.para: Change connection tracking dump interval.
If set to 1 (default) a internal hash will be stored and only destroy event will reach the output plugin. It set to 0, all events are reveived by the output plugin.
Size of the internal hash bucket.
Maximum number of entries in the internal connection hash.

Select event received from kernel based on a mask. Event types are defined as follows:
Creation event: 0x00000001
Update event: 0x00000002
Destroy event: 0x00000004
Specify the base socket buffer size. This start value will be increased if needed up to netlink_socket_buffer_maxsize.
Specify the base socket buffer maximum size.
set the number of seconds that we wait to perform a resynchronization due to a netlink overrun. default timeout is 60 seconds (less agressive).
same as NFLOG above.
string representation of conntrack mark, value[/mask]
same as NFLOG above.

refsect2.title: nursd_producer_NFCT2.so (NFCT2)
refsect2.para: This interfaces the nfnetlink_conntrack kernel subsystem, and provides flow-based logging. To compile, you need libnetfilter_conntrack installed on your system.

listitem.para: same as NFCT above.
same as NFLOG above.
same as NFLOG above.
same as NFLOG above.
set NFQA_CFG_F_FAIL_OPEN config flag.
set NFQA_CFG_F_CONNTRACK config flag.
set NFQA_CFG_F_GSO config flag.
set NFQA_CFG_F_UID_GID config flag.
set NFQA_CFG_F_SECCTX config flag.
same as NFLOG above.
same as NFLOG above.
same as NFLOG above.

refsect2.title: nurs_filter_PACKICMP.so (PACKICMP)
refsect2.para: create IPFIX icmpTypeCodeIPv4 uint16_t value from uint8_t icmp code and uint8_t icmp type.

refsect2.title: nurs_filter_TIMECONV.so (TIMECONV)
refsect2.para: create time values required for IPFIX or Netflow v9 from uint32_t sec and usec. And also create uptime values from /proc/timer_list

listitem.para: create IPFIX time values from uint32_t time values.
create Netflow v9 uptime values.

refsect2.title: nurs_coveter_IPFIX.so (IPFIX), nurs_coveter_NFLOW9.so (NFLOW9)
refsect2.para: Suppose NFCT2 is the producer, convert input keys which has IPFIX field to IPFIX or Netflow v9 format and send it to file, TCP or UDP socket. SCTP output has not implemented.

refsect1.title: QUESTIONS / COMMENTS
refsect1.para: All comments / questions / ... are appreciated. Just drop a note to chamas@h4.dion.ne.jp

refsect1.title: Authors
refsect1.para: nursd was written by Ken-ichirou MATSUZAWA, based on ulogd2.
